meanings.sent1: The books on the shelf were placed in an orderly manner.
meanings.sent2: Her desk is always so orderly with everything in its place.
meanings.sent3: The ants formed an orderly line to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden bloomed in an orderly fashion, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's instructions were so clear and orderly that everyone understood the task.

meanings.definition: A person who helps maintain order and cleanliness
meanings.sent1: The hospital orderly quickly responded to the nurse's call for assistance.
meanings.sent2: The school orderly made sure the hallways were free of clutter.
meanings.sent3: The zoo animals thought the new orderly was quite amusing with his funny dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The orderly of the library was like a guardian, ensuring all books were in their proper place.
meanings.sent5: The orderly's presence in the chaotic room brought a sense of calm and control.

meanings.definition: Done or proceeding in a systematic way
meanings.sent1: The orderly process of completing paperwork made the task easier.
meanings.sent2: The factory workers followed an orderly routine to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt at juggling knives while cooking was quite orderly, surprisingly.
meanings.sent4: The orderly progression of the seasons reminded him of the cycle of life.
meanings.sent5: The students followed the teacher's instructions in an orderly fashion, one step at a time.
